help.starting_installation_text:
To use the app full screen and offline:

• **iPhone / iPad:** Find the **Share** button (square with arrow icon) in your browser's navigation bar and select **'Add to Home Screen'**.
• **Android:** Open the options menu (**3 dots**) in Chrome and select **'Install app'** or 'Add to Home Screen'.
• **PC / Mac:** Look for the **Install App** icon in the browser address bar.
help.starting_requirements_text:
• **Browser:** Chrome, Safari, Edge, or compatible.
• **SD Card:** Original files from your Tanita (BC-601/602/613).
• **Offline:** Works 100% offline after installation.
help.starting_first_steps_text:
1. **Load (Inbox):** Drag or upload the `DATA.CSV` files from your SD card.
2. **Link (Inbox):** Assign each new measurement to its corresponding client.
3. **Analyze (Clients):** View progress charts and metrics.

*Note: Create the client profile in the Clients tab first.*
help.clients_creation_text: We recommend using **Codes** (e.g., `C001`) or **Aliases** (e.g., `JOHN-DOE`) instead of real names. Keep a private external record linking the code to the patient's real identity.
help.clients_buttons_logic_text:
The scale has 4 limited physical memory slots. We recommend this setup:

• **Buttons 1, 2, and 3:** For personal use or recurring family members.
• **Button 4 (Clients):** Use this to measure all your clients using 'Multi-User Mode'.
help.clients_infinite_trick_text:
**You must repeat these steps for EACH new measurement** taken with Button 4:

1. **REMOVE THE SD CARD** from the scale.
2. Hold **SET**, choose **Button 4**, and configure the profile (Age, Height...).
3. When it asks **CLr?** (Clear), select **YES** (since the SD is removed, it won't delete the file).
4. **INSERT THE SD CARD** again.
5. Step on the scale.

**Result:** The new measurement is appended to the end of `DATA4.CSV`, preserving all previous ones.
help.files_structure_text:
BodyMetrics reads `DATA.CSV` files in **read-only** mode; it never modifies your SD card.

The app creates a **'virtual link'** in your browser that associates measurement dates with Clients.
help.files_troubleshooting_text:
If your SD card has accumulated history on the 4 memory slots, organize it first:

1. Load the files for **Button 1** (`DATA1.CSV` and `DATA5.CSV`) and link them to that family member (e.g., 'Mom').
2. Next, load those for **Button 2** and assign them. Repeat until all 4 buttons are done.

**Important:** Once all old history is linked, **you can load all files together**. The App will recognize what is already saved and only show you new measurements in the Inbox.
*Note: Be sure to link old Button 4 data before overwriting it for 'Multi-User Mode'.*
help.interpretation_text:
Health algorithms and ranges strictly follow the **Official Tanita Manual**.

• **Health Indicators:** Colors (Blue, Green, Yellow, Red) adapt dynamically based on age and gender.
• **Body Map:** Tap on any body zone to view the segmental analysis.
• **Contextual Help:** Look for the `(i)` icons to understand what each metric and color means.
help.security_local_data_text: BodyMetrics has no database server or cloud. **Your clinical data never leaves your device**.
help.security_transparency_text:
Privacy Guarantee:
• **No Tracking:** We do not use advertising cookies or Google Analytics.
• **Volatile Memory:** Files are processed in your browser's RAM; we do not keep copies.
• **Technical Logs:** The IP is only visible at the infrastructure level (Cloudflare/Server) for security against attacks, never associated with health data.
help.security_link_text: The app's 'memory' resides in your browser. If you clear your **browsing data**, the links will be lost (but your SD files will remain intact).
help.security_backups_text: It is **critical** to make frequent backups via Settings > **Download Backup**. This generates a JSON file with all your clients and links.
help.security_restoration_intro: Use **Load Backup** to recover your work after clearing the browser or changing PCs.
help.security_manual_sync_text:
If you use multiple devices (e.g., PC and Tablet), data **does not update automatically**. You must sync manually:

1. **Save** the Backup (`BM_Backup.json`) from the device where you made changes.
2. **Load** that backup on the other device along with the **DATA** files from the SD.

**Golden Rule:** If you make a change on one device and don't load the backup on the other, you won't see those changes.
help.security_warning_sync:
**Manual Sync (No Cloud):**
If you use multiple devices (e.g., PC and Tablet), data **does not update automatically**. You must sync manually:

1. **Save** the Backup (`BM_Backup_Date_Time.json`) from the device where you made changes (e.g., created a client, linked data).
2. **Load** that backup on the other device along with the **DATA** files from the SD.

**Golden Rule:** If you make a change on one device and don't load the backup on the other, you won't see those changes. You must repeat this process every time you switch devices.
help.viewer_text:
**BodyMetrics Viewer** is a lightweight tool for your clients to view their own progress.

**Steps:**
1. Go to the client's profile and click **Export**.
2. Send the `BM_Alias_Date_Time.csv` file to your client (WhatsApp/Email).
3. The client loads that file into the Viewer.

The Viewer works offline and allows the client to view their charts without needing accounts or registration.
help.troubleshooting_which_file_text:
• **Day-to-day:** The original SD files (e.g., `DATA1.CSV`, `DATA4.CSV`).
• **Restore data:** Your backup file (`BM_Backup_Date_Time.json`).
• **For the Viewer (Client):** The file exported from their profile (`BM_Alias_Date_Time.csv`).
help.troubleshooting_missing_data_text: Due to security and browser limitations, **you must load the SD files in every session**. The app remembers the links but needs to read the 'physical' file each time to display the values.
help.troubleshooting_date_text: If you see old dates, the scale's internal clock has reset (probably due to battery change). Adjust the date on the physical scale.
help.about_description: FOSS (Free and Open Source Software) tool for body composition analysis. Designed to be secure, private, and free.
help.about_disclaimer: Independent project. Not affiliated with Tanita Corp.
help.support_description:
Hi! I'm an independent developer focused on health and privacy tools.

This project is free and non-commercial. Donations help cover server costs, domains, and the hours dedicated to maintenance and continuous improvement.

If this tool is useful for your work, consider buying me a coffee.
